definition: Foreign Affairs Office (at a university)/Foreign Affairs Department
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: Hello, this is the Foreign Affairs Police.
sentences.chinese: 您好，這裏是臺北市警局外事處。

sentences.english: The exchange students should give the meal card back to the Foreign Affairs Office.
sentences.chinese: 交換生離校時應把飯卡交回外事處留學生辦公室。

sentences.english: Post contracts from Foreign Affairs Department and confirming contract terms with foreign teachers.
sentences.chinese: 外事處寄發合同給外籍教師，確定合同條款。

sentences.english: Both the Foreign Office and the Ministry of Defence have declined to comment on the reports.
sentences.chinese: 外事處和國防部都拒絕對這些報道做出評論。

sentences.english: Good morning. We re from the Foreign Affairs Department.
sentences.chinese: 早晨好，我們是外事處的。

sentences.english: The Foreign Affairs Office is the management unit for foreign teachers.
sentences.chinese: 外事處爲外籍教師的主管部門。

sentences.english: Hello, this is the Taipei Foreign Affairs Police.
sentences.chinese: 您好，這裏是臺北市警局外事處。

sentences.english: Students resuming study should apply for X visa to come to China.
sentences.chinese: 來華自費留學生完成學業後由外事處頒發在學證明。

sentences.english: FAO will arrange physical exam or verification for new students.
sentences.chinese: 外事處將在新生入學後統一安排體檢。

sentences.english: Ask for comment from college after Foreign Affairs Department's initial review.
sentences.chinese: 外事處初審後轉二級學院，徵求二級學院意見。
